Incheon Jayu Park built 1888 represents the first modern park in the country, with its design inspired by famous Western parks.Take a moderately difficult walk up the hill, where you can enjoy the view, and also admire the monument dedicated to General MacArthur, a celebrated warrior from the Korean War. Here you can learn more about the war and its consequences, as well as about other important moments in Korean history.The park serves as a venue for special occasions, such as festivals, concerts, and various performances, but on a daily basis it serves as a popular place for families to go on picnics and relax in the nature.

Built in 1888, Liberty Park is South Korea's oldest modern Western park and a symbol of Incheon Central. Diplomats from China, the United States, Britain and Japan have signed agreements for the park's construction. Liberty Park was called the "Park of Nations" at the beginning of its construction. After the battle of Incheon, the bronze statue of General MacArthur, who led the United States Marines to successfully land in Incheon, was built in honor of the decisive battle of the Korean War. Since then, the "National Park" has been renamed "Free Park". In addition, this park has also been a film and television productions, by Cui Shuzhi and Zhang Baizhi starring the film "Pran", comedy film "Young Lux Madonna", TV drama "Piano Love" "Temptation Technology" and other styles of works have been filmed here.
